messages.message: Course Introduction

messages.author: bot
messages.message: Hi, welcome to My Chatbot :)

messages.author: bot
messages.message: In this course you'll learn what a modern chatbot is and how it comes to be.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: Of course, before that you will need to learn some basic concepts.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: That way you will be able to have a wider grasp on the subject.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: I'll introduce myself! My name is Chatot and my job is to teach this course.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: After I give you some context in the introductory section...

messages.author: bot
messages.message: ... you will be able to ask me some questions regarding the current chapter.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: As you see, there are some images appearing on the right.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: This will be this course's visual aid / presentation.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: You can always access it by using the \slides command.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: Remember you can use + instead of \, if you'd like.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: Depending on your question, you will unlock more slides in the presentation.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: You can also freely switch to each chapter's conceptual map activity.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: For that, use the \concept command.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: While asking the questions, some keywords will appear in the conceptual map.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: And when you have enough, you should be able to connect them all.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: When you're done connecting them all, you finish the chapter!

messages.author: bot
messages.message: If you need any suggestions on which questions to ask, type \suggest.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: We don't save any of your data in our servers, so if you need a break...

messages.author: bot
messages.message: ... you can send me the \break command to get a save code.

messages.author: no-auth
messages.message: You are free to ask questions now.

contents.context: My name is Chatot. I teach this course. A chatbot is an AI program. This course is about learning what chatbots are and how they are made. I don't have thoughts or feelings.

messages.author: no-auth
messages.message: Artificial Intelligence (AI)

messages.author: bot
messages.message: By now, most people have heard about artificial intelligence.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: And it truly is everywhere.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: For example, your smartphone's voice controls...

messages.author: bot
messages.message: ... and basically every video game in existence.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: Even image recognition is possible because of AI.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: So...

messages.author: no-auth
messages.message: You are free to ask questions now.

contents.context: AI is a broad field of computer science. AI tries incorporates human intelligence into computer programs. AI works by following specific rules and algorithms, like generalized strategies. An example of AI is the minimax algorithm. Minimax tries to find the optimal move for a player in a two-player game. The minimax algorithm is used in chess, go and tic-tac-toe! Machine learning is a form of implementing AI.

messages.author: no-auth
messages.message: Machine Learning (ML) and Deep Learning

messages.author: bot
messages.message: Now we know what AI is.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: But machine learning is also a term you might have heard being used a lot.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: Or maybe you've heard of deep learning...

messages.author: bot
messages.message: Spoilers: They are definitely an important part of artificial intelligence.

messages.author: no-auth
messages.message: You are free to ask questions now.

contents.context: Machine learning is a technique used to make programs improve and learn from data. More details: There are different ML categories and it works differently based on its learning type. Machine learning can be unsupervised, supervised, or based on reinforcement. Supervised learning uses classified datasets to teach the model how to classify new data. Unsupervised learning tries to find patterns within the given data. Reinforcement learning works via trial-and-error improvement based on actions and rewards. Deep learning is part of machine learning. Deep learning is machine learning that uses algorithms and structures that imitate the architecture of the brain. An example of deep learning is using structures called neural networks. It is called deep because there are many layers within the neural network architecture. An example of machine learning is the perceptron. The perceptron is a program used for machine learning and it is based on a single neuron. A perceptron, it learns to classify data in two categories like red or blue. A neural network is made of multiple perceptrons connected to each other.

messages.author: no-auth
messages.message: Natural Language Processing (NLP)

messages.author: bot
messages.message: First of all, how does a computer even understand human language?

messages.author: bot
messages.message: They just understand ones and zeros...

messages.author: bot
messages.message: ... and languages are already not the easiest to grasp...

messages.author: bot
messages.message: ... so there has to be a way to codify language to be able to work with it.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: And we have to be able to know what is possible to do with language and computers.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: This is what's called called Natural Language Processing (NLP).

messages.author: bot
messages.message: Now, you also know that AI attempts to include human intelligence into programs.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: That partly includes languages.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: Which means they truly go hand-in-hand.

messages.author: no-auth
messages.message: You are free to ask questions now.

contents.context: NLP is the same as natural language processing. NLP is a computer-based approach to analyzing text based on a set of linguistic theories. AI is closely related to NLP because of its goal. The main goal of NLP is achieving a human-like level of language. NLP can be separated into natural language understanding and natural language generation. Natural language understanding receives human language and gives it a structure that computers can understand and interpret. In natural language generation a program uses computer language models to create language that people can understand. NLP can be used for auto-correcting spelling mistakes, language translation and chatbots.

messages.author: no-auth
messages.message: NLP Tasks and Machine Learning

messages.author: bot
messages.message: Some practical applications for NLP are used in everyday life.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: For example, translating languages...

messages.author: bot
messages.message: ... or spam detectors for your email.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: Virtual assistants like Siri and Alexa need to understand what you want when you talk to them.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: Even the auto-complete function in your phone tries to predict what you want to type.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: In this case, the program uses a model more related to AI than to ML called a Hidden Markov Model.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: And it can detect typos, too!

messages.author: bot
messages.message: This chapter's question section will be about sentiment analysis.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: Which is a fairly simple NLP task and serves as a good example.

messages.author: no-auth
messages.message: You are free to ask questions now.

contents.context: Sentiment analysis is an application of NLP that tries to measure how positive or negative a text is. Sentiment analysis, it uses many examples to classify how emotionally charged a sentence or a paragraph is. Sentiment analysis without machine learning would try to detect keywords or patterns that might influence the emotional score. A weakness of sentiment analysis is human language's complexity and context dependency. An example of this complexity is sarcasm being detected wrongly.

messages.author: no-auth
messages.message: Early Chatbots

messages.author: bot
messages.message: Historically, some chatbot names are better known as others.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: The earliest ones were inspired by the Turing test.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: To pass the test, people needed to be convinced that they were interacting with another person instead of a program.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: So people tried to simulate a human-like conversation with computer programs.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: The most famous ones are probably Eliza (1966) and ALICE (1995).

messages.author: no-auth
messages.message: You are free to ask questions now.

contents.context: Eliza is a chatbot that acts like a psychotherapist. It works by formulating clever sentences that allow the user to just keep talking. ALICE is a chatbot that won the Loebner prize three times. The Loebner prize is an annual contest based on the Turing test. ALICE works by using special tags (AIML) that allows bots to recognize patterns. AIML is a markup language that helps to simplify pattern detection in input texts. These two bots are examples or kinds of rule-based chatbots, that means they are chatbots made by writing all its responses/response patterns by hand.

messages.author: no-auth
messages.message: Chatbot Categories

messages.author: bot
messages.message: In this chapter, you'll learn about what other types of chatbots there are.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: There are four categories to classify them with:

messages.author: bot
messages.message: Interaction modality

messages.author: bot
messages.message: Knowledge domain

messages.author: bot
messages.message: Chatbot's goals

messages.author: bot
messages.message: and design approach

messages.author: no-auth
messages.message: You are free to ask questions now.

contents.context: Interaction modality classifies chatbots as (written) text-based or speech-based. A chatbot's knowledge domain can be open or closed domain. An open domain means the chatbot tries to understand and talk about any topic it's given. A closed domain means the chatbot can only talk about a specific subject. The chatbot's goals can be task-oriented or non-task-oriented. A task-oriented chatbot is made for a particular task. A non-task-oriented chatbot is made to simulate a general conversation. A chatbot's design can be rule-based, retrieval-based, or generative. A rule-based chatbot requires mostly hand-made templates to be able to respond. A retrieval-based chatbot uses deep learning to extract a response from a knowledge database. A generative chatbot is able to produce text responses on its own by using neural network models.

messages.author: no-auth
messages.message: Modern Chatbots - Part 1

messages.author: no-auth
messages.message: Text Preprocessing

messages.author: bot
messages.message: Before we start covering specific language models, it's important to start from the beginning.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: If we want to use a ML language model, we have to feed it some language data.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: But as mentioned before, computers don't really understand anything other than ones and zeros.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: In order to further simplify the process for the program...

messages.author: bot
messages.message: ... some things need to be removed from the text.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: For example, to a computer the words 'Bot' and 'bot' are different...

messages.author: bot
messages.message: ... because both 'B's are codified differently.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: Or _  _  maybe  _ _ there  _ _ are too _  _ many blank spaces _ _  ...

messages.author: bot
messages.message: Or too... many **special** symbols?!!! in the text.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: Normalizing the text includes removing these unnecessary details.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: Obviously, depending on which domain you are working on, different factors get normalized.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: There are other ways of preprocessing text.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: Like stemming, which removes everything except a word's stem.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: This might output non-existent stems.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: And lemmatization, a smarter form of stemming, is more accurate and outputs correct word stems...

messages.author: bot
messages.message: But it requires contextual data or training to function properly.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: Now, language models don't use plain text (strings) to train.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: They need vectorization and tokenization.

messages.author: no-auth
messages.message: You are free to ask questions now.

contents.context: Vectorization entails transforming plain text into a numerical representation. Vectors can be created from whole texts, sentences or single words. The goal of vectorization is creating vectors that are similar when the meaning of their content is similar as well. Tokenization should happen before vectorizing text. Tokenization means splitting the text into smaller units like words. Tokenization is good in the sense that it makes plain text easier to understand for the computer. The bad part of tokenization is that the single tokens don't necessarily carry much meaning within them.

messages.author: no-auth
messages.message: Modern Chatbots - Part 2

messages.author: no-auth
messages.message: Current State of the Art

messages.author: no-auth
messages.message: (Early 2023)

messages.author: bot
messages.message: There are different ways of using neural networks for NLP.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: Some predecessors of the current state of the art are recurrent neural networks (RNN) and long short-term memory networks (LSTM).

messages.author: bot
messages.message: We won't cover these network models in the course.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: But you've probably already heard about ChatGPT and its influence by now.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: It and its three predecessors, GPT 1, 2 and 3 are all transformer language models.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: There is another important transformer model called BERT.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: Understanding how they differ is not relevant for now.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: But transformers... what are they?

messages.author: bot
messages.message: In this course you will learn a very simplified version of what they are.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: It won't be short, though!

messages.author: bot
messages.message: Also please try to ask questions based on the steps in the simplified model.

messages.author: no-auth
messages.message: You are free to ask questions now.

contents.context: Transformers are an Encoder-Decoder model. An encoder, it is the component that initially takes an input text (usually a sentence) and transforms it. A decoder is the component that reads the encoded data and predicts a sequence of words. This decoded sequence could be a language translation or a response to a question. Step 1: Everything starts by utilizing a word embedding. A word embedding is a mapping of words in a vector space. A mapping is something like a word-to-vector dictionary. Step 2: All these word vectors are then assigned positional data based on where they are in the sentence. Step 3: The input is encoded through a layer of self-attention. What happens within self-attention is a comparison of each word with all of the others in the sentence. This comparison calculates how relevant a word's meaning is in relation to another single word. Step 4: Each newly calculated vector gets transformed further and normalized to simplify future calculations. Step 5:The now transformed data gets sent to the decoder. Step 6: The decoder receives an embedding based on what its target goal is. Step 7: the vectors from the embedding receive positional data. Step 8: The decoder embedding passes through a masked attention layer. Step 9: The data passes through a second attention layer together with the encoded data. Step 10: The data gets normalized. Step 11: The data gets made into a probability vector for the next most likely word. Step 12: The output word gets used as an input to continue the sequence until it finishes.

messages.author: no-auth
messages.message: RoBERTa and your Chatbot Tutor

messages.author: bot
messages.message: The chatbot that serves as a tutor in this course...

messages.author: bot
messages.message: ... is actually a version of BERT, so a transformer language model.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: RoBERTa stands for Robustly Optimized BERT Approach.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: As its name suggests, it's an optimized version of BERT and it performs better than it in many ways.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: RoBERTa is a pre-trained model, but it can be trained further (fine-tuned) to fulfill specific tasks.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: This version of RoBERTa is trained in question answering.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: Some strengths of the model are pretty clear.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: The questions you send don't need much special formatting, and don't even need to be formulated as questions.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: It's even robust against some typos.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: And when it has low confidence in an answer, it signals it.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: But the model is very dependent on the data you give it.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: And changing a single word can affect its pattern detection significantly.

messages.author: bot
messages.message: In the Q&A section you can ask about some pros, cons, and characteristics of your chatbot tutor.

messages.author: no-auth
messages.message: You are free to ask questions now.

contents.context: Some pros include that the chatbot model understands questions and the context without specific programming. A con of the chatbot model is that it might not be able to respond to a question when the context is too complex. The chatbot model can be classified as retrieval-based and task-oriented in a closed domain. The chatbot model got trained in question answering with a dataset called SQuAD 2.0. The SQuAD dataset contains 150k example questions and answers

messages.author: bot

messages.author: bot
messages.message: Also you can ask me anything from any chapter from the course.
